page.title: 16Community Assoc. Activities
page.content:
The principal activity of the BCA is {Village Day}held in June on the Barn Hall field. Many of the affiliated clubs run stalls, side-shows and competitions. In 1985 Â£3500 was raised by Village Day & the entertainments & concerts of Village Week that followed
The BCA are the publishers of the local 'Bookhams Bulletin'.
The BCA also founded the Polesden Lacey Open Air Theatre in 1951. The 1st production was A Midsummer Nights Dream. The stage was built by volun- teers from Bookham. The Theatre was later handed over to the National Trust, but the BCA still maintain a close interest. In 1985, The Merry Wives of Windsor & The Mikado were performed.
